intro: Verbascum vollmannii, commonly known as the desert mullein, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, showy yellow flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in soft, woolly hairs, which help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Verbascum vollmannii is adapted to withstand extreme temperatures and drought conditions.
